did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Ezra Lahad Yiddish & Hebrew theater : ephemera,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Yiddish and other theater ephemera including Purim plays, a program aabout Ida Kaminska and the Jewish State Theatre of Poland, and programs for the Fourth Theatre Festival of Moscow-Leningrad, 1936.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on access.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ezra Lahad Yiddish & Hebrew theater : ephemera. M1133. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Ezra Lahad (1918-1995) was born in Minsk, attended a Yiddish-language gymnasium in Vilna (Vilnieus), and emigrated to Palestine in 1935. From 1948 to 1961 he served in the Israeli Defense Forces, in military procurement and ammunitions. His last position in the IDF was editor of the bulletin of the Israeli fleet, "Be-ma'arkhot yam." Subsequently, in civilian life, he edited a publication issued by the municipality of Haifa, "Hefah 'ovedet." Upon retirement he served as a volunteer at the Ghetto Fighters' House, a Holocaust museum and archive located in a kibbutz in northern Israel that was established by Holocaust survivors.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: Yiddish and other theater ephemera including Purim plays, a program aabout Ida Kaminska and the Jewish State Theatre of Poland, and programs for the Fourth Theatre Festival of Moscow-Leningrad, 1936.

Incoming mail to Lahad Ezra and family
A letter to the Ghetto Fighters Museum1976

scopecontent.p: This letter was written by Kremerman Yehezkel. It includes his memories from the Vilna ghetto.
This folder contains Rose Shoshana's appeal in the newspaper and the resulting correspondence.

did.unittitle: Incoming mail to Ezra Lahad and family
Ida Kaminska and the Jewish State Theatre of Poland1967

scopecontent.p: The folder contains a portfolio of his roles in a postcard format.
This folder contains a copy of a bibliographical work by Yaari Avraham, titled Ha-Mahazeh Ha-ivri, with many notes added by Ezra Lahad.

did.unittitle: Goset State Yiddish Theater in Moscow

scopecontent.p: This folder contains a printout with the history of the theater and pictures of actors and scenes.
The folder contains programs and bewspaper clippings.
This folder contains the immigration certificate from the Government of Palestine to Ezra Lahad's family (Parents and sister) allowing the family to enter Palestine.

This folder contains newspaper clippings concerning Muli Lahad. One is a story about an accident he had with his family, and the other is an interview with him, as a psychologist working in a crisis center in Northern Israel, about dealing with crisis.
This is a recording (cassette) of an interview with Ezra Lahad in the Israeli radio

scopecontent.p: this folder contais Lahad's collection of Ex Libris plates.
This folder includes a letter from Watsow Ghetto, an interview with Mosheh Kraus.
This folder contains pamphlets about Tel Aviv, the Common Market, and more.
